required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: FORE-SIGHT Tissue Oximeter During Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: CAS Medical Systems FORE-SIGHT Elite Tissue Oximeter During Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure cerebral and lower extremity oximetry on patients during cardiac surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this research study is to collect data from a tissue oximeter device that measures brain oxygen saturation simultaneous with data from the same device that monitors skeletal muscle during cardiac surgery. This monitoring will allow for continuous, non-invasive, and earlier assessment of perfusion abnormalities/hypoperfusion.
Two sensors from the FORE-SIGHT Elite monitor will be placed on the forehead above the eyebrows and two additional sensors will be placed on the leg muscles. Data from the FORE-SIGHT Elite monitor will be recorded in addition to clinical and demographic data, which is standard of care during the procedure, for research purposes to look at factors associated with desaturations.

primary_outcome.description: Two sensors from FORE-SIGHT Elite monitor will be placed on the forehead above the eyebrows to continuously monitor cerebral oxygen saturation.

secondary_outcome.description: Two sensors from FORE-SIGHT Elite monitor will be placed on the leg muscles to continuously monitor non-cerebral/skeletal muscle oxygen saturation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects where cerebral oximetry is monitored during their surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Birthmarks, tattoos, or other skin abnormalities that FORE-SIGHT Sensors cannot avoid

facility.name: Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center, Department of Anesthesiology
